default_choose_summary_span.title: Choose Summary Span to Align
default_choose_summary_span.text:
Choose a summary span to align.
Remember: make sure it covers full events and doesn't contain too many details (so you don't miss any when aligning it).

default_find_alignment.title: Find the Alignment
default_find_alignment.text:

Remember: make sure the alignment covers all the information described in the summary span and nothing else.

choose_summary_span.title: Choose Summary Span to Align - Pay attention!
choose_summary_span.text:
Do not work with the full summary sentence, as it is very long and contains many details.
Instead, opt to work one sub-span at a time.
make sure the span you choose covers full events and also doesn't contain too many details (so you don't miss any when aligning it).

choose_summary_span.title: Choose Summary Span to Align - Pay attention!
choose_summary_span.text:
Even though the summary sentence is quite short and it is tempting to simply choose all of it, you will notice that the information in it is spread out across the whole document.
Therefore, to make sure you don't miss anything, it is recommended to work in small summary spans.
In other words, work on each "grain" separately.

1.title: Find the Alignment - Pay Attention
1.text:
This is a tough one.
Make sure the alignment covers only the information mentioned in the summary span and nothing else.
If you are overwhelmed by all the boldfaced words, try hovering over "34" (should color in red the relevant document words).

2.title: Find the Alignment - Pay Attention
2.text:
This is a tough one.
Make sure the alignment covers only the information mentioned in the summary span and nothing else.
If you are overwhelmed by all the boldfaced words, try hovering over "soybeans" and "23".
In addition, notice that even if you didn't highlight in the summary "Compared to last year", or "down", it is still implied in the summary span and should be included in the alignment.
